Package manager

Class Manager

java.lang.Object
manager.Manager
public class Manager extends Object
Connects actions on the GUI to computations performed and data retrieved from other classes. Operates on the singleton pattern.
Author:
Hunter Pruitt

      public void setCurrentList(Media.MediaType mt, Preferences.SortFocus focus)
      Sets the currentList for use with the GUI.
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType enum for which list should be used
      focus - sort method to sort data, null if no change

      Parameters:
      a - Media object (hopefully an Anime) to remove
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the passed index is out of bounds

    • removeManga

      public void removeManga(Media m)
      Removes a selected manga from the mangaList
      Parameters:
      m - Media object (hopefully a Manga) to remove
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the passed index is out of bounds

    • getAllAnimeAsArray

      public Object[][] getAllAnimeAsArray()
      Grabs title, year, and count for each anime for display on the GUI. Return is type Object[][] so that ints and Strings are both displayed in the table together. It could be type String[][], but ultimately doesn't matter. The sorting for this method is dependent on the sorting method of the list that the pointer animeList is set to. This pointer can be changed by the user in the OptionsView
      Returns:
      2D array of anime data for display on the GUI

    • getAllMangaAsArray

      public Object[][] getAllMangaAsArray()
      Grabs title, year, and count for each manga for display on the GUI. Return is type Object[][] so that ints and Strings are both displayed in the table together. It could be type String[][], but ultimately doesn't matter. The sorting for this method is dependent on the sorting method of the list that the pointer mangaList is set to. This pointer can be changed by the user in the OptionsView
      Returns:
      2D array of manga data for display on the GUI

    • setSortMethod

      public void setSortMethod(Media.MediaType mt, Preferences.SortFocus sortBy)
      Changes the sorting method and retrieves the proper SortedMediaList to use
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType indicating which data the method needs to work with
      sortBy - SortFocus to sort media by

    • setColorMethod

      public void setColorMethod(Media.MediaType mt, Preferences.ColorMethod colorBy)
      Changes the sorting method and retrieves the proper animeList to use
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType indicating which data the method needs to work with
      colorBy - ColorMethod to sort anime by

    • setColorOnlyFinished

      public void setColorOnlyFinished(Media.MediaType mt, boolean color)
      Changes the sorting method and retrieves the proper animeList to use
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType indicating which data the method needs to work with
      color - flag indicating if only media that is finished should be colored

    • setColor

      public void setColor(Media.MediaType mt, String pointer, Color c)
      Sets the designated color to the color passed as a parameter
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType indicating which data the method needs to work with
      pointer - String name indicating which user color is to be changed
      c - Color to set the user color to
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if passed a bad pointer

    • getEntryCount

      public String getEntryCount(Media.MediaType mt)
      Returns the number of entries for use as a stat on the HomeView
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType to get data for
      Returns:
      total number of entries
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no MediaType is indicated

    • getNumSeries

      public String getNumSeries(Media.MediaType mt)
      Returns the number of entries that are series for use as a stat on the HomeView
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType to get data for
      Returns:
      total number of series
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no MediaType is indicated

    • getNumSpecial

      public String getNumSpecial(Media.MediaType mt)
      Returns the number of entries that are classified as specials for use as a stat on the HomeView
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType to get data for
      Returns:
      total number of specials
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no MediaType is indicated

    • getCountSum

      public String getCountSum(Media.MediaType mt)
      Returns the sum of all counts for use as a stat on the HomeView
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType to get data for
      Returns:
      sum of all anime or manga counts
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no MediaType is indicated

    • getFavoredLanguageAndPercent

      public String getFavoredLanguageAndPercent()
      Computes the most used language type by entry (not count) and the percent for display
      Returns:
      most used language and its percent as a String for the GUI, "N/A" if list is empty

    • getPercentFinished

      public String getPercentFinished(Media.MediaType mt)
      Provides a string representation of the user's percent of finished media, followed by the percent sign (%)
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType to get data for
      Returns:
      percent of total anime or manga finished, "N/A" if list is empty
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no MediaType is indicated

    • getPercentDropped

      public String getPercentDropped(Media.MediaType mt)
      Provides a string representation of the user's percent of dropped media, followed by the percent sign (%)
      Parameters:
      mt - MediaType to get data for
      Returns:
      percent of total anime dropped, "N/A" if list is empty
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no MediaType is indicated

    • getPercentOngoing

      public String getPercentOngoing()
      Provides a string representation of the user's percent of ongoing media, followed by the percent sign (%)
      Returns:
      percent of total manga still ongoing, "N/A" if list is empty

    • getFavoredPublisher

      public String getFavoredPublisher()
      Provides the name of the publisher found most frequently in the media list. Subject to error if user is inconsistent with publisher spelling and spacing. In case of a tie, "Tie" is returned
      Returns:
      name of most common publisher
